q: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
h:
“Quality is not an act, it is a habit.” —
Aristotle

q: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I took the one less traveled by, and that has made all the difference.
h:
“Two roads diverged in a wood, and I took the one less traveled by, and that has made all the difference.” —
Robert Frost

q: Always turn a negative situation into a positive situation.
h:
“Always turn a negative situation into a positive situation.” —
Michael Jordan

q: Stress happens when the mind resists what is.
h:
“Stress happens when the mind resists what is.” —
Dan Millman

q: If you focus on results and finding shortcuts, you'll get impatient. If you focus on the process and doing the right thing, you'll be unstoppable.
h:
“If you focus on results and finding shortcuts, you'll get impatient. If you focus on the process and doing the right thing, you'll be unstoppable.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: You have the freedom to be yourself, your true self, here and now, and nothing can stand in your way.
h:
“You have the freedom to be yourself, your true self, here and now, and nothing can stand in your way.” —
Richard Bach

q: Every one of us is the sum total of his own thoughts.
h:
“Every one of us is the sum total of his own thoughts.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: The chief cause of failure and unhappiness is trading what you want most for what you want right now.
h:
“The chief cause of failure and unhappiness is trading what you want most for what you want right now.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Don't let the noise of others' opinions drown out your own inner voice.
h:
“Don't let the noise of others' opinions drown out your own inner voice.” —
Steve Jobs

q: We've got to live, no matter how many skies have fallen.
h:
“We've got to live, no matter how many skies have fallen.” —
D. H. Lawrence

q: People spend too much time doing and not enough time thinking about what they should be doing.
h:
“People spend too much time doing and not enough time thinking about what they should be doing.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: If you want to achieve greatness stop asking for permission.
h:
“If you want to achieve greatness stop asking for permission.” —
Unknown

q: The quality of your life is determined by the quality of questions you ask.
h:
“The quality of your life is determined by the quality of questions you ask.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Keep your friends close, and your enemies closer.
h:
“Keep your friends close, and your enemies closer.” —
Sun Tzu

q: We take care of the future best by taking care of the present now.
h:
“We take care of the future best by taking care of the present now.” —
Jon Kabat-Zinn

q: Rewards and punishment is the lowest form of education.
h:
“Rewards and punishment is the lowest form of education.” —
Zhuangzi

q: Remember, hope is a good thing, maybe the best of things.
h:
“Remember, hope is a good thing, maybe the best of things.” —
Stephen King

q: Don't settle, and don't struggle.
h:
“Don't settle, and don't struggle.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: Money poisons you when you've got it, and starves you when you haven't.
h:
“Money poisons you when you've got it, and starves you when you haven't.” —
D. H. Lawrence

q: In order to control myself I must first accept myself by going with and not against my nature.
h:
“In order to control myself I must first accept myself by going with and not against my nature.” —
Bruce Lee

q: Against the assault of laughter nothing can stand.
h:
“Against the assault of laughter nothing can stand.” —
Mark Twain

q: Life is much like going to the gym. The most painful part is deciding to go. Once you get past that, it's easy.
h:
“Life is much like going to the gym. The most painful part is deciding to go. Once you get past that, it's easy.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Well done is better than well said.
h:
“Well done is better than well said.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: Life is about choice. You can choose to be a victim or anything else you like to be.
h:
“Life is about choice. You can choose to be a victim or anything else you like to be.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart.
h:
“Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make one.
h:
“The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make one.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: The impossible can always be broken down into possibilities.
h:
“The impossible can always be broken down into possibilities.” —
Unknown

q: The guest will judge better of a feast than the cook.
h:
“The guest will judge better of a feast than the cook.” —
Aristotle

q: Whatever you are, be a good one.
h:
“Whatever you are, be a good one.” —
Abraham Lincoln

q: A woman unsatisfied must have luxuries. But a woman who loves a man would sleep on a board.
h:
“A woman unsatisfied must have luxuries. But a woman who loves a man would sleep on a board.” —
D. H. Lawrence

q: Never give up on a dream just because of the time it will take to accomplish it. The time will pass anyway.
h:
“Never give up on a dream just because of the time it will take to accomplish it. The time will pass anyway.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: The key to success is failure.
h:
“The key to success is failure.” —
Michael Jordan

q: The whole is greater than the sum of its parts.
h:
“The whole is greater than the sum of its parts.” —
Aristotle

q: Walk slowly but never walk backward.
h:
“Walk slowly but never walk backward.” —
Unknown

q: Dance first. Think later. It's the natural order.
h:
“Dance first. Think later. It's the natural order.” —
Samuel Beckett

q: If you want to be happy, do not dwell in the past, do not worry about the future, focus on living fully in the present.
h:
“If you want to be happy, do not dwell in the past, do not worry about the future, focus on living fully in the present.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Everybody has talent, but ability takes hard work.
h:
“Everybody has talent, but ability takes hard work.” —
Michael Jordan

q: Productize your perspective.
h:
“Productize your perspective.” —
Jack Butcher

q: Adventure is worthwhile in itself.
h:
“Adventure is worthwhile in itself.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Each day your life grows a day shorter. Make every move count.
h:
“Each day your life grows a day shorter. Make every move count.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Everything is in your own heart.
h:
“Everything is in your own heart.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: Men trust their ears less than their eyes.
h:
“Men trust their ears less than their eyes.” —
Herodotus

q: People rarely succeed unless they have fun in what they are doing.
h:
“People rarely succeed unless they have fun in what they are doing.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: Avoiding failure is to avoid progress.
h:
“Avoiding failure is to avoid progress.” —
Unknown

q: By perseverance the snail reached the ark.
h:
“By perseverance the snail reached the ark.” —
Charles Spurgeon

q: You don't have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
h:
“You don't have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: The best way to not feel hopeless is to get up and do something.
h:
“The best way to not feel hopeless is to get up and do something.” —
Barack Obama

q: No matter what happens, always be yourself.
h:
“No matter what happens, always be yourself.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: Start each day with a positive thought and a grateful heart.
h:
“Start each day with a positive thought and a grateful heart.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Life is trying things to see if they work.
h:
“Life is trying things to see if they work.” —
Ray Bradbury
